body_html:
This bug should was fixed by 23caae7, which is part of TF 1.3. I tested your repro script with the released version of 1.3 and it works as intended.

(There was previously an issue where it was not possible to define new "TensorFlow functions" after the first use of a tf.Session. Since defining a new dataset often involves defining new functions, this limited how you could use datasets. Thanks are due to @skye for fixing the underlying issue!)

(There was previously an issue where it was not possible to define new "TensorFlow functions" after the first use of a tf.Session. Since defining a new dataset often involves defining new functions, this limited how you could use datasets. Thanks are due to @skye for fixing the underlying issue!)
body:
This bug should was fixed by 23caae7408cf6bb961d1bab0c8b819d88ccf5f3c, which is part of TF 1.3. I tested your repro script with the released version of 1.3 and it works as intended.

(There was previously an issue where it was not possible to define new "TensorFlow functions" after the first use of a `tf.Session`. Since defining a new dataset often involves defining new functions, this limited how you could use datasets. Thanks are due to @skye for fixing the underlying issue!)
